name: Google Docs Dark Mode 2020 (jer)
description: A dark theme for Google Docs, works as of 2020, plan to keep it working for my own benefit. Nothing special or perfect, just a dark theme with no big blocks of white to burn your eyes at night.
additional_info: Planning to put it on Github but wanted to get it posted here in the meantime. Specific features of Google Docs that this supports: - GDocs Table of contents - Comments and suggestions Here's some notes about it: - Avoid background highlighting. You'll need to clean up any background colors within your document or else they will show as ugly blocks of white. Often white background highlighting is invisible but when you use a theme like this, they will be very obvious. Select the text, right click, and choose "Clear Formatting" at the bottom. - Things you see constantly should be dark. I tried to make everything that is perpetually visible dark, but am not going to try to convert every single modal window to dark mode, so things like the "File" menus and the "Custom Spacing" or "Word Count" popups will be white, hope that's ok. - Based on Monokai.This is based on an older (broken) style that did a lot of the initial work (https://userstyles.org/styles/150408/google-docs-monokai-dark-background) but it's a constant job so I'm hoping I can keep mine up to date. - The CSS is a mess. Please don't judge me, just trying to get it working. Hopefully I'll clean it up one day.
